Iâ€™m Ajit Raikar, co-founder and CEO at Validus Capital. We are a Singapore-based peer-to-business lending platform which connects growing SMEs to accredited and institutional investors.

Our online marketplace is powered by a proprietary platform, which utilizes a robust risk algorithm that was developed in partnership with the Credit Research Initiative (CRI) team of National University of Singaporeâ€™s Risk Management Institute (NUS-RMI). Our data-driven, collaborative approach to business lending has helped us to forge strong industry partnerships with many established brands, such as Visa.

Prior to Validus, I held senior management roles across major financial institutions. In the field of SME financing, Iâ€™ve dealt with banking verticals for coverage and risk across multiple geographies including Singapore and Indonesia. At Citibank, I pioneered its SME banking concept which was replicated across Citibank globally. I was also formerly regional head of strategy for the SME team at DBS.

Please ask me anything! This can include:

  • Why I decided to take the leap from banking to a fintech startup
  • My experiences in dealing with SMEs from both a bank and startup perspective
  • How companies and startups can reach sustainability in order to obtain funding from alternative lenders and banks
  • State of P2P finance lending in Southeast Asia
  • Something personal:
    • My favorite books
    • What it is like working at Validus
    • My favorite food
    • How I spend my weekends
